name: Diego Hernandez
bio: Diego Hernandez is a front-end developer at IBM and Software Engineering graduate student at DePaul University in Chicago. He is a trained filmmaker, turned self-taught developer and designer. As a creative person, Diego is always looking for ways to stretch his canvas—in this case, web browsers—to create unique web experiences that tell a story. When he’s not coding, you’ll probably find him attempting to indoor rock climb or in the kitchen trying out a new recipe.
talkTitle: Reinforcing your blocks: A practical guide to UI component testing

name: Isabela Moreira
bio: Isabela is a huge fan of the intersection of code and design and also loves mechanical keyboards. She’s an advocate for women and minorities in tech and frequently speaks out on Twitter and provides tech resources on her blog.
talkTitle: Starting from Scratch: The Startup's Guide to Creating a Design System

name: J.C. Hiatt
about: Software Engineer & Growth Manager at Echobind
bio: [J.C. Hiatt](https://jchiatt.com) is Software Engineer & Growth Manager at [Echobind](https://echobind.com), where he helps build awesome applications with JavaScript, React, React Native, and GraphQL and grow the community through education and training. He is also the founder of [DevLifts](https://devlifts.io), a developer-centric fitness company focused on helping developers live healthier lives. He’s an [Egghead instructor](https://egghead.io/instructors/jc-hiatt), an organizer of multiple meetups, and the organizer of the annual [MagnoliaJS conference](https://magnoliajs.com) held in Jackson, Mississippi. In his spare time, you’ll find him with his wife and dog. He is also a Reformed member of the Christian faith and is active in his local church. You can [follow him on Twitter here](https://twitter.com/jchiatt).
talkTitle: Pass the interview! Common questions and answers for frontend positions

name: Jennifer Wadella
bio: Jennifer Wadella has been writing code since before she realized it was a credible career path. She currently works as a JavaScript Consultant and loves building performant web applications, speaking at technical conferences, and brewing kombucha. Jennifer is an active member of the KC tech community and the founder of Kansas City Women in Technology(KCWiT), an organization aimed at growing the number of women in technology careers in Kansas City. She is the PubConf Sydney 2018 Champion, a Silicon Prairie Champion Award Nominee, Rising Trendsetter STEMMy award-winner, and is apparently Missouri’s Coolest Woman according to Pure Wow.
talkTitle: Hacking your work life __ balance to take over the world.

name: Karl L. Hughes
bio: Karl Hughes has been building software and teams for education technology startups in Chicago for the past several years. He is currently the CTO at The Graide Network where he oversees architecture, testing, and product planning. Besides code, he likes  writing in prose and cooking veggie burgers.
talkTitle: Stop Writing Code and Start Solving Problems

name: Braidy Merkle
bio: Braidy is a globe trotting, improv performing, volleyball playing software engineer who never saw herself going into tech. She has learned Spanish, German, and Italian, and one day discovered that computer languages are fun to learn too. She grew up around Chicago, but has lived in numerous cities among 3 continents. She believes her heart is from Vienna, Austria (where she hopes to one day return).  She’s always up for a challenge, and frequently tries new things. Unfortunately she also has impossibly high standards for herself, so has had to learn the beauty of living with imperfection.

name: Angela Malone
talkTitle: Build a mobile app overnight with Draftbit: What, Why & How

name: Tracy Lee
bio: Tracy is the Co-Founder of This Dot Labs, a consultancy focused on helping companies with digital transformations. She is also a Google Developer Expert, RxJS Core Team member, a Women Techmakers Lead, and a frequent keynote speaker at conferences. She heads up Community Relations for Node.js at OpenJS Foundation, is the host of the Modern Web podcast, organizer of This.JavaScript, Contributor Days, Google Developer Group Silicon Valley and Triangle, and RxWorkshop. You can find her on Twitter @ladyleet or at http://thisdot.co/labs.

name: Brian Ambielli
bio: Brian is a Seattle native living in Chicago, working as a software engineer on Flexport's Chicago-based trucking team. He is curious about Data Science, and is pursuing a Masters in Analytics from Georgia Tech. On weekends you'll find him biking and blogging (maybe at the same time), or helping to plan the next edition of the Chicago Logistics Tech meetup. Check out bambielli.com to see what he's up to.
talkTitle: Preparing Transmission's Web Frontend for Scale

name: Westin Wrzesinski
talkTitle: Typescript: How I learned to love my Javascript

name: Josh Hargreaves
talkTitle: Using JavaScript to Power Finance's Most Powerful Tool

name: Mackenzie Bryant
about: iOS Developer, Mobile Technical Track Lead at Women Who Code
talkTitle: How I went from a Bootcamp to leading the global mobile team for WomenWhoCode
